project_description: A Flutter project using the Stacked architecture, featuring routing, dependency injection, and dialog/bottom sheet management. The app now includes an onboarding flow for a luxury chauffeur service called Gyde.
architecture_overview: The application follows the Stacked architecture with separate folders for app setup, features, UI components, and utilities. It uses Stacked for state management, routing, and dependency injection. The onboarding flow is integrated with sliding transitions between pages.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs. It includes routes for onboarding flow and services (BottomSheetService, DialogService, NavigationService). The file structure allows for easy addition of new services, routes, bottom sheets, and dialogs using the @stacked-import, @stacked-route, @stacked-service, @stacked-bottom-sheet, and @stacked-dialog annotations.

files.name: lib/features/app/app_view.dart
files.description: Defines the root widget of the application

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/welcome_view.dart
files.description: The welcome page of the onboarding flow with 'Get Started' and luxury travel introduction.

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/auth_options_view.dart
files.description: Page for authentication options with 'Continue with Phone' and 'Continue with Email'.

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/phone_input_view.dart
files.description: Page for phone number input for user verification.

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/verification_view.dart
files.description: Page for entering the verification code sent to the user's phone.

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/email_collection_view.dart
files.description: Page for collecting user's email for tailored services.

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/welcome_confirmation_view.dart
files.description: Welcome confirmation page after successful onboarding.

files.name: lib/features/onboarding/terms_conditions_view.dart
files.description: Page displaying terms and conditions for the user to agree.

files.name: lib/features/startup/startup_view.dart
files.description: The startup view shown when the app is first launched.

files.name: lib/features/startup/startup_viewmodel.dart
files.description: ViewModel for the StartupView, handles initialization logic.

methods.name: runStartupLogic
methods.description: Runs the startup logic and navigates to the onboarding flow

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The entry point of the application. Sets up the app and runs it.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main function that runs the app

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant main
participant AppView
participant StartupView
participant StartupViewModel
participant WelcomeView
participant AuthOptionsView
participant PhoneInputView
participant VerificationView
participant EmailCollectionView
participant WelcomeConfirmationView
participant TermsConditionsView

User -> main: Launch app
main -> AppView: Create and run
AppView -> StartupView: Initialize
StartupView -> StartupViewModel: Run startup logic
StartupViewModel -> WelcomeView: Navigate on completion
User -> WelcomeView: Interact
WelcomeView -> AuthOptionsView: Next
AuthOptionsView -> PhoneInputView: Continue with Phone
PhoneInputView -> VerificationView: Enter phone number
VerificationView -> EmailCollectionView: Enter code
EmailCollectionView -> WelcomeConfirmationView: Enter email
WelcomeConfirmationView -> TermsConditionsView: Continue
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Stacked architecture. ViewModels handle the business logic and state for their respective views. The app.locator.dart file sets up dependency injection, while app.router.dart manages navigation between views.
navigation_flow: The application starts with main.dart, which sets up the app and runs AppView. AppView initializes the Stacked architecture and shows the StartupView. After completing initialization logic, it navigates to the onboarding flow starting with the WelcomeView. Navigation between onboarding pages is handled by the Stacked Router defined in app.router.dart.
